introduction: In this video, the basics of HTML and CSS are introduced. HTML is used for structuring web content, while CSS is used for controlling the presentation of the content. The video explains the difference between the two and provides an example of CSS code and HTML code.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to HTML
content: Explanation of HTML as the root element for web content.
Overview of HTML tags for data and text.
Recognition of HTML tags based on start and end tags.
Example of HTML code with CSS and content being displayed.

sections.title: Section 2: HTML Tags and Structure
content: Explanation of different HTML tags for various types of content.
Definition of header, body, and section tags.
Range of different header types defined in CSS.
Comparison of HTML code without CSS and with CSS applied.

sections.title: Section 3: CSS Basics
content: Introduction to CSS as the presentation language for HTML.
Explanation of CSS selectors and properties.
Example of CSS code for different text colors and font sizes.
Comparison of HTML content with and without CSS applied.

sections.title: Section 4: CSS Properties and Selectors
content: Overview of CSS properties for text, color, and font size.
Explanation of CSS selectors for targeting specific elements.
Example of CSS code for different text colors and font sizes.
Comparison of HTML content with and without CSS applied.

sections.title: Section 5: Summary and Practice
content: Review of HTML and CSS basics.
Practice exercises for applying CSS to HTML content.
Explanation of how to ignore CSS code and view plain HTML content.
Final thoughts on the importance of understanding HTML and CSS.
